seniority_level.evidence: Title is generic Data Engineer with no seniority qualifier and no years of experience stated; required skill set suggests more than entry level but not explicitly senior.

job_family.evidence: Job title explicitly says "Data Engineer" and responsibilities focus on data pipelines, modeling, and quality.

sub_specialty.evidence: Mentions Airflow, Luigi, Dagster, Prefect and CDC pipelines, all typical of batch/ETL workloads; no streaming technologies are listed.

leadership_expectation.evidence: No references to people‑management, team lead or direct reports; responsibilities are technical execution.

primary_cloud.evidence: The posting lists Databricks and data‑quality tools but does not name any cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP).

secondary_clouds.evidence: No additional cloud providers are referenced in the text.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Orchestration tools mentioned (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster, Prefect) are primarily used for batch scheduling; no streaming frameworks are cited.

orchestrator_category.evidence: Airflow is explicitly listed among required skills; other orchestrators are mentioned but Airflow is the canonical example.

storage_layer.evidence: The description talks about data pipelines and modeling but does not specify warehouses, lakes, or lakehouses.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location restriction field lists only "KR" (South Korea) as allowed country.

timezone_focus.evidence: Job is based in Seoul, South Korea, which falls in the APAC region.

relocation_required.evidence: No relocation language appears; the role is tied to a specific city (Seoul).

h1b_friendly.evidence: Pass 1 extraction shows visa sponsorship is "not_mentioned"; Korean companies typically do not sponsor H‑1B.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of OPT/CPT or student‑visa friendliness; work authorization is implied for Korean residents.

citizenship_required.evidence: Geo restriction to South Korea suggests candidates must be authorized to work in Korea, but citizenship is not explicitly required.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Typical Korean full‑time roles are employee (W‑2) positions; no contract or C2C language is present.

benefits_level.evidence: Pass 1 extraction lists no benefits, equity, learning or conference budgets.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: The posting does not discuss promotion ladders, career tracks, or growth opportunities.

mentorship_signals.evidence: No reference to mentorship programs, senior partners, or learning from experienced staff.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No language about promotions or advancement paths appears in the text.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: The job description does not mention internal transfers or mobility programs.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No explicit mention of IC, management, specialist, or architect tracks.

requirement_strictness.evidence: A long list of mandatory hard skills (SQL, Python, Airflow, Luigi, Dagster, Prefect, Databricks, Great Expectations, Soda) with no nice‑to‑have items.

scope_definition.evidence: The responsibilities focus specifically on data engineering, modeling, pipeline quality, and platform work; no unrelated duties are mixed.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Required skill set aligns with a mid‑level data engineer; no unrealistic senior‑level expectations are present.
